body: Dear Chris and Mostapha, Thanks for your clarification! Yes, I agree with you that using "Indoor operative temperature" for the Y axis of the adaptive comfort chart might be less confusing, and plus it is consistent with what is presented in the ASHRAE standard. Users should be able to use the outputs of this component to filter out those measurements within or outside the acceptable limits. Speaking of the outputs of this component, I got the following issue which I'd like to have your advice: As shown in the image, the output of the "comfortableOrNot" node has 2 branches and 17534 values, which is strange because the input epw file has only 8760 hourly data (8767 including the headers). Sth must have caused the duplication, and I hope you can kindly point out what I missed here. Thank you!
